title: Contributing to gsdd
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to gsdd
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to gsdd
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. Begin commit merge messages - indicate user facing changes included NEWS.md. use fledge automatically generate NEWS.md file.

title: Contributing to gsdd
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to gsdd
text: Please note gsdd project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with gsdd
text: Thanks using gsdd! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with gsdd
text: opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with gsdd
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

text: Thorley J, Lyons S (2024). gsdd: Calculate Growing Season Degree Days Water Temperature Data. R package version 0.3.0.9000, https://github.com/poissonconsulting/gsdd, https://poissonconsulting.github.io/gsdd/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gsdd: Calculate Growing Season Degree Days from Water Temperature Data},   author = {Joe Thorley and Sarah Lyons},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.3.0.9000, https://github.com/poissonconsulting/gsdd},   url = {https://poissonconsulting.github.io/gsdd/}, }

title: Calculate Growing Season Degree Days from Water Temperature Data
text: gsdd R package calculate Growing Season Degree Days (GSDD), Growing Degree Days (GDD) Growing Seasons (GSS) water temperature data. GSSD water temperature metric useful predictor age-0 trout size beginning winter. accumulated thermal units (°C) growing season based mean daily water temperature values. GDD GSSD particular date. GSDD calculated across longest consecutive sequence non-missing values. Truncation occurs start /end sequence non-missing values part way growing season. user chooses ignore truncation returned value(s) likely less actual value(s). default values implementation growing season based Coleman Fausch (2007) stated defined start growing season beginning first week average stream temperatures exceeded remained 5°C season; end growing season defined last day first week average stream temperature dropped 4°C. purposes calculation week refers seven day rolling average opposed calendar week. multiple growing ‘seasons’ within year default returned value sum GSDD values "" seasons.

title: Calculate Growing Season Degree Days from Water Temperature Data
text: Coleman, M.., Fausch, K.D. 2007. Cold Summer Temperature Limits Recruitment Age-0 Cutthroat Trout High-Elevation Colorado Streams. Transactions American Fisheries Society 136(5): 1231–1244. doi:10.1577/T05-244.1.

title: Calculate Growing Season Degree Days from Water Temperature Data
Calculate Growing Season Degree Days from Water Temperature Data
text: gssd package provides functions calculate GSSD, GDD GSS water temperature data. also provides function plot water temperature data.  calculate GSDD vector.
code: library(gsdd) data <- gsdd::temperature_data  gsdd(data) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>    year  gsdd #>   <int> <dbl> #> 1  2019 3899. gdd(data) #> # A tibble: 1 × 2 #>    year   gdd #>   <int> <dbl> #> 1  2019 3605. gss(data) #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #> # Groups:   year [1] #>    year start_dayte end_dayte   gsdd truncation #>   <int> <date>      <date>     <dbl> <chr>      #> 1  2019 1971-03-20  1971-11-07 3899. none gss_plot(data) x <- gsdd::temperature_data$temperature  gsdd_vctr(x) #> [1] 3898.806

what: Calculate Date of Accumulated Thermal Units (ATUs) — date_atus
title: Calculate Date of Accumulated Thermal Units (ATUs) — date_atus
text: Calculates date specified number Accumulated Thermal Units (ATUs) meet exceeded.

title: Calculate Date of Accumulated Thermal Units (ATUs) — date_atus
Calculate Date of Accumulated Thermal Units (ATUs) — date_atus
text: x data frame two columns date temperature. date, must class Date provides dates temperature must numeric vector provides mean daily water temperature degrees centigrade. atus positive number accumulated thermal units exceed. start_date Date scalar first date within year consider (year ignored). #' start_date occurs end_date (ignoring year) window considered  span two calendar years.

title: Calculate Date of Accumulated Thermal Units (ATUs) — date_atus
text: tibble four columns year, start_date, end_date atus.

title: Calculate Date of Accumulated Thermal Units (ATUs) — date_atus
code: date_atus(gsdd::temperature_data) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #> # Groups:   year [2] #>    year start_date end_date    atus #>   <int> <date>     <date>     <dbl> #> 1  2018 1971-03-01 NA           NA  #> 2  2019 1971-03-01 1971-05-11  617.

title: Calculate Growing Degree Days (GDD) — gdd
text: Calculate number growing degree days specified end date.

title: Calculate Growing Degree Days (GDD) — gdd
code: gdd(   x,   start_date = as.Date("1972-03-01"),   end_date = as.Date("1972-09-30"),   min_length = NULL,   ignore_truncation = FALSE,   start_temp = 5,   end_temp = 4,   window_width = 7,   pick = "all",   msgs = TRUE )

title: Calculate Growing Degree Days (GDD) — gdd
text: x data frame two columns date temperature. date, must class Date provides dates temperature must numeric vector provides mean daily water temperature degrees centigrade. start_date Date scalar first date within year consider (year ignored). #' start_date occurs end_date (ignoring year) window considered  span two calendar years. end_date Date scalar last date within year consider (year ignored). min_length whole number minimum length consider. Must least twice window width 365. NULL set difference start_date end_date (ignoring year). ignore_truncation flag specifying whether ignore start truncation (end truncation always ignored). start_temp positive real number average water temperature start growing season(s) C. end_temp positive real number average water temperature end growing season(s) C. must greater equal start temperature. window_width positive whole number width rolling mean window days. default 7. pick string specifying whether pick "longest", "shortest", "first" "last" 'season' season "biggest" "smallest" GSDD. default returned value GSDD value "longest" 'season'. msgs flag specifying whether provide messages.

title: Calculate Growing Degree Days (GDD) — gdd
text: tibble two columns year gdd.

text: Growing Season Degree Days (GSDD) water temperature metric useful predictor age-0 trout size beginning winter. accumulated thermal units (C) growing season based mean daily water temperature values.

title: Calculate Growing Season Degree Days (GSDD) — gsdd
code: gsdd(   x,   start_date = as.Date("1972-03-01"),   end_date = as.Date("1972-11-30"),   ignore_truncation = FALSE,   min_length = NULL,   start_temp = 5,   end_temp = 4,   window_width = 7,   pick = "all",   msgs = TRUE )

title: Calculate Growing Season Degree Days (GSDD) — gsdd
text: x data frame two columns date temperature. date, must class Date provides dates temperature must numeric vector provides mean daily water temperature degrees centigrade. start_date Date scalar first date within year consider (year ignored). #' start_date occurs end_date (ignoring year) window considered  span two calendar years. end_date Date scalar last date within year consider (year ignored). ignore_truncation flag specifying whether ignore truncation mean daily water temperature vector string "start", "end", "none" (equivalent FALSE) "" (equivalent TRUE) specifying type truncation ignore. min_length whole number minimum length consider. Must least twice window width 365. NULL set difference start_date end_date (ignoring year). start_temp positive real number average water temperature start growing season(s) C. end_temp positive real number average water temperature end growing season(s) C. must greater equal start temperature. window_width positive whole number width rolling mean window days. default 7. pick string specifying whether pick "longest", "shortest", "first" "last" 'season' season "biggest" "smallest" GSDD. default returned value GSDD value "longest" 'season'. msgs flag specifying whether provide messages.

title: Calculate Growing Season Degree Days (GSDD) — gsdd
text: tibble two columns year gsdd.

title: Calculate Growing Season Degree Days (GSDD) — gsdd
text: GSDD calculated across longest consecutive sequence non-missing values. Truncation occurs start /end sequence non-missing values part way growing season. user chooses ignore truncation returned value likely less actual value. default values implementation growing season based Coleman Fausch (2007) stated defined start growing season beginning first week average stream temperatures exceeded remained 5C season; end growing season defined last day first week average stream temperature dropped 4C. purposes calculation week refers seven day rolling average opposed calendar week. multiple growing 'seasons' within year default returned value sum GSDD values "" seasons. user option pick "first"/"last" "longest"/"shortest" season season "biggest"/"smallest" GSDD. user picks "longest" season multiple seasons longest length candidate season "biggest" GSDD selected. Conversely case multiple "shortest" seasons candidate "smallest" GSDD selected.

title: Calculate Growing Season Degree Days (GSDD) — gsdd
text: Coleman, M.., Fausch, K.D. 2007. Cold Summer Temperature Limits Recruitment Age-0 Cutthroat Trout High-Elevation Colorado Streams. Transactions American Fisheries Society 136(5): 1231–1244. doi:10.1577/T05-244.1.

title: Calculate Growing Season Degree Days (GSDD) from a vector — gsdd_vctr
text: Calculate Growing Season Degree Days (GSDD) vector

title: Calculate Growing Season Degree Days (GSDD) from a vector — gsdd_vctr
code: gsdd_vctr(   x,   ignore_truncation = FALSE,   min_length = 274,   start_temp = 5,   end_temp = 4,   window_width = 7,   pick = "all",   complete = FALSE,   msgs = TRUE )

title: Calculate Growing Season Degree Days (GSDD) from a vector — gsdd_vctr
text: x numeric vector mean daily water temperature values period interest C. ignore_truncation flag specifying whether ignore truncation mean daily water temperature vector string "start", "end", "none" (equivalent FALSE) "" (equivalent TRUE) specifying type truncation ignore. min_length whole number minimum length consider. Must least twice window width 365. NULL set difference start_date end_date (ignoring year). start_temp positive real number average water temperature start growing season(s) C. end_temp positive real number average water temperature end growing season(s) C. must greater equal start temperature. window_width positive whole number width rolling mean window days. default 7. pick string specifying whether pick "longest", "shortest", "first" "last" 'season' season "biggest" "smallest" GSDD. default returned value GSDD value "longest" 'season'. complete flag specifying whether vector water temperatures represents complete possible growing period (default FALSE). TRUE growing season considered truncated start /end water temperature threshold start /ends. msgs flag specifying whether provide messages.

title: Calculate Growing Season Degree Days (GSDD) from a vector — gsdd_vctr
text: non-negative real number GSDD.

title: Calculate Growing Season Degree Days (GSDD) from a vector — gsdd_vctr
code: gsdd_vctr(c(rep(1, 10), rep(10, 20), rep(1, 200))) #> `The length of `x` must be at least 274. #> [1] NA gsdd_vctr(gsdd::temperature_data$temperature) #> [1] 3898.806

title: Calculate Growing Seasons (GSS) — gss
text: x data frame two columns date temperature. date, must class Date provides dates temperature must numeric vector provides mean daily water temperature degrees centigrade. start_date Date scalar first date within year consider (year ignored). #' start_date occurs end_date (ignoring year) window considered  span two calendar years. end_date Date scalar last date within year consider (year ignored). min_length whole number minimum length consider. Must least twice window width 365. NULL set difference start_date end_date (ignoring year). ignore_truncation flag specifying whether ignore truncation mean daily water temperature vector string "start", "end", "none" (equivalent FALSE) "" (equivalent TRUE) specifying type truncation ignore. start_temp positive real number average water temperature start growing season(s) C. end_temp positive real number average water temperature end growing season(s) C. must greater equal start temperature. window_width positive whole number width rolling mean window days. default 7. pick string specifying whether pick "longest", "shortest", "first" "last" 'season' season "biggest" "smallest" GSDD. default returned value GSDD value "longest" 'season'. msgs flag specifying whether provide messages.

title: Plot Growing Seasons (GSS) — gss_plot
text: x data frame two columns date temperature. date, must class Date provides dates temperature must numeric vector provides mean daily water temperature degrees centigrade. start_date Date scalar first date within year consider (year ignored). #' start_date occurs end_date (ignoring year) window considered  span two calendar years. end_date Date scalar last date within year consider (year ignored). min_length whole number minimum length consider. Must least twice window width 365. NULL set difference start_date end_date (ignoring year). ignore_truncation flag specifying whether ignore truncation mean daily water temperature vector string "start", "end", "none" (equivalent FALSE) "" (equivalent TRUE) specifying type truncation ignore. start_temp positive real number average water temperature start growing season(s) C. end_temp positive real number average water temperature end growing season(s) C. must greater equal start temperature. window_width positive whole number width rolling mean window days. default 7. pick string specifying whether pick "longest", "shortest", "first" "last" 'season' season "biggest" "smallest" GSDD. default returned value GSDD value "longest" 'season'. latex flag specifying whether use LaTeX include degree symbol y-axis label. nrow count number rows facet . ncol count number columns facet . msgs flag specifying whether provide messages.

text: atus positive number accumulated thermal units exceed. complete flag specifying whether vector water temperatures represents complete possible growing period (default FALSE). TRUE growing season considered truncated start /end water temperature threshold start /ends. end_date Date scalar last date within year consider (year ignored). end_temp positive real number average water temperature end growing season(s) C. must greater equal start temperature. ignore_truncation flag specifying whether ignore truncation mean daily water temperature vector string "start", "end", "none" (equivalent FALSE) "" (equivalent TRUE) specifying type truncation ignore. latex flag specifying whether use LaTeX include degree symbol y-axis label. min_length whole number minimum length consider. Must least twice window width 365. NULL set difference start_date end_date (ignoring year). msgs flag specifying whether provide messages. ncol count number columns facet . nrow count number rows facet . pick string specifying whether pick "longest", "shortest", "first" "last" 'season' season "biggest" "smallest" GSDD. default returned value GSDD value "longest" 'season'. start_date Date scalar first date within year consider (year ignored). #' start_date occurs end_date (ignoring year) window considered  span two calendar years. start_temp positive real number average water temperature start growing season(s) C. window_width positive whole number width rolling mean window days. default 7. x data frame two columns date temperature. date, must class Date provides dates temperature must numeric vector provides mean daily water temperature degrees centigrade.

Mean Daily Water Temperature Data — temperature_data
text: tibble columns: date Date vector. temperature real vector mean daily water temperature values based seasonal sine wave. temperature2 real vector mean daily water temperature values two discrete growing seasons.

title: gsdd 0.3.0.9000
text: Internal changes.

title: gsdd 0.3.0
text: Added date_atus() determine date ATUs reached. (#9). Add latex = FALSE argument gss_plot() turn use LaTeX add degree symbol y-axis label.

title: gsdd 0.2.0
text: Added complete = FALSE argument gsdd_vctr() gss_vctr() specify whether vector water temperatures represents complete growing period. Modified gsdd(), gdd(), gss() gss_plot() growing season considered truncated start /end water temperature threshold start /end dates. growing season now includes border indicate truncated. x-axis now always includes start end dates. y-axis label now includes degree symbol. Mean 7 Day instead Series Moving legend. Fixed shift gss() time series starts start date.

title: gsdd 0.1.0
text: Added gss_plot() output ggplot object temperature time series.

title: gsdd 0.0.2
text: Added truncation column output gss() indicate season truncated.

title: gsdd 0.0.1
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
